eiteam.esteemedinnovation.api.tool

Interface SteamToolUpgrade


  • public interface SteamToolUpgrade
    This interface is used to create your own upgrades for SteamTools. Below describes how you can go about creating and registering your own own upgrades.

    Creating an upgrade

    In most cases, you will need to create a new custom object/class in order to create a new upgrade for a steam tool. It must inherit the interface, SteamToolUpgrade. Sometimes, you can get away with using a generic base-class that provides simple and generic implementations of all of the required SteamToolUpgrade methods.

    Special behavior

    The methods above on their own do not provide any special behavior. They simply allow the upgrade to be put into tools, and provide new icon overlays and tooltip info for them. SteamToolUpgrade provides a variety of on* methods for special behavior. It is recommended to simply look at the methods provided by the interface to see what is possible.

    The on* methods that return a boolean will cancel their according event when false is returned by any upgrade, preventing any further processing. There is no ensured order in which upgrade on* methods are called.

    The on* methods all get called after making sure the tool is wound up. If you don't care about that, then you need your own event handler.

    Tool strength

    There are two methods that allow the upgrade to modify the tool's strength:
    • getToolStrength(IBlockState, ItemStack, ItemStack)
    • modifiesToolStrength()

    Registering an upgrade

    The upgrade must be registered accordingly, otherwise it will not work. First, it must be registered as an ordinary item. Then, it must be registered using ToolUpgradeRegistry.register(SteamToolUpgrade).

    • Method Detail

      • getToolSlot

        SteamToolSlot getToolSlot()
        The slot that the upgrade can be used on
        See Also:
        SteamToolSlot

      • getInformation

        java.lang.String getInformation(net.minecraft.item.ItemStack me,
                                net.minecraft.item.ItemStack tool)
        The information added to the tool's tooltip. If it is null it will simply use the item's name
        Parameters:
        me - The ItemStack of the upgrade.
        tool - The ItemStack containing the tool
        Returns:
        The information string. Can be null, expect null.

      • getBaseIcon

        net.minecraft.util.ResourceLocation getBaseIcon()
        Returns:
        The base icon name. Does not include the name of the tool (Drill, Saw, Shovel) or the index (0, 1). Return null if the upgrade does not add any texture to the tool.

        Examples: The void upgrade would return esteemedinnovation:toolUpgrades/void The thermal upgrade would return esteemedinnovation:toolUpgrades/thermal

      • isUniversal

        boolean isUniversal()
        Whether the upgrade is a universal upgrade. This will determine how to load the icons.
        Returns:
        Boolean

      • onBlockBreakWithTool

        default boolean onBlockBreakWithTool(net.minecraftforge.event.world.BlockEvent.BreakEvent event,
                                     @Nonnull
                                     net.minecraft.item.ItemStack toolStack,
                                     @Nonnull
                                     net.minecraft.item.ItemStack thisUpgradeStack)
        Called in ItemSteamTool.ToolUpgradeEventDelegator.onBlockBreak(BlockEvent.BreakEvent) for every upgrade in the steam tool, after the ticks and speed NBT are updated.
        Parameters:
        event - The actual event container. The player is not null.
        toolStack - The ItemStack containing the tool.
        thisUpgradeStack - The ItemStack containing this upgrade.
        Returns:
        Return false to cancel the breaking of the block and prevent any other processing from happening.

      • onRightClickWithTool

        default boolean onRightClickWithTool(net.minecraftforge.event.entity.player.PlayerInteractEvent.RightClickItem event,
                                     @Nonnull
                                     net.minecraft.item.ItemStack toolStack,
                                     @Nonnull
                                     net.minecraft.item.ItemStack thisUpgradeStack)
        Called in ItemSteamTool.ToolUpgradeEventDelegator.onRightClickItem(PlayerInteractEvent.RightClickItem) for every upgrade in the steam tool.
        Parameters:
        event - The actual event container.
        toolStack - The ItemStack containing the tool.
        thisUpgradeStack - The ItemStack containing this upgrade.
        Returns:
        Return false to cancel the click and prevent any other processing from happening.

      • onPlayerHarvestDropsWithTool

        default void onPlayerHarvestDropsWithTool(net.minecraftforge.event.world.BlockEvent.HarvestDropsEvent event,
                                          @Nonnull
                                          net.minecraft.item.ItemStack toolStack,
                                          @Nonnull
                                          net.minecraft.item.ItemStack thisUpgradeStack)
        Called from ItemSteamTool.ToolUpgradeEventDelegator.onHarvestDrops(BlockEvent.HarvestDropsEvent) for every upgrade in the steam tool.
        Parameters:
        event - The actual event container. A few things in the event are sanitized before this method is called.

        The things sanitized/checked before this is called:

        • The player (BlockEvent.HarvestDropsEvent#getHarvester())
        • The blockstate and block for the blockstate (BlockEvent.HarvestDropsEvent#getState() and IBlockState.getBlock()
        • The tool being used to harvest (which is passed as a parameter to this method). The nullness of its item is also checked, as well as whether it is actually a SteamTool.
        toolStack - The tool in the player's main hand, confirmed to contain a SteamTool and be nonnull.
        thisUpgradeStack - The ItemStack containing this upgrade.

      • onUpdateBreakSpeedWithTool

        default void onUpdateBreakSpeedWithTool(net.minecraftforge.event.entity.player.PlayerEvent.BreakSpeed event,
                                        @Nonnull
                                        net.minecraft.item.ItemStack toolStack,
                                        @Nonnull
                                        net.minecraft.item.ItemStack thisUpgradeStack)
        Called from ItemSteamTool.ToolUpgradeEventDelegator.onBlockBreakSpeedUpdate(PlayerEvent.BreakSpeed) for every upgrade in the steam tool. Although the event is cancellable, don't. Use onBlockBreakWithTool for that.
        Parameters:
        event - The actual event container. A few things in the event are sanitized before this method is called.

        The things sanitized/checked before this is called:

        • The block and blockstate at the position are not null.
        Use PlayerEvent.BreakSpeed.setNewSpeed(float) to set the new speed value, just as you would if you had subscribed to this event normally.
        toolStack - The ItemStack containing the tool (player's main hand). Confirmed to be nonnull and contain a SteamTool.
        thisUpgradeStack - The ItemStack containing this upgrade.

        default boolean onRightClickBlockWithTool(net.minecraftforge.event.entity.player.PlayerInteractEvent.RightClickBlock event,
                                          @Nonnull
                                          net.minecraft.item.ItemStack toolStack,

                                          net.minecraft.item.ItemStack thisUpgradeStack)

        Parameters:
        event - The actual event container.
        toolStack - The ItemStack containing the tool.
        thisUpgradeStack - The ItemStack containing this upgrade.
        Returns:
        Return false to cancel the click and prevent any other processing from happening.

      • onAttackWithTool

        default boolean onAttackWithTool(@Nonnull
                                 net.minecraft.entity.player.EntityPlayer attacker,
                                 @Nonnull
                                 net.minecraft.entity.EntityLivingBase victim,
                                 net.minecraft.util.DamageSource damageSource,
                                 @Nonnull
                                 net.minecraft.item.ItemStack toolStack,
                                 @Nonnull
                                 net.minecraft.item.ItemStack thisUpgradeStack)
        Called in ItemSteamTool.ToolUpgradeEventDelegator.onAttack(LivingAttackEvent) for every upgrade in the steam tool.
        Parameters:
        attacker - The player attacking.
        victim - The entity being attacked by the player.
        damageSource - The DamageSource.
        toolStack - The ItemStack containing the tool.
        thisUpgradeStack - The ItemStack containing this upgrade.
        Returns:
        Return false to cancel the attack and prevent any other processing from happening.

      • getToolStrength

        default int getToolStrength(net.minecraft.block.state.IBlockState state,
                            net.minecraft.item.ItemStack toolStack,
                            net.minecraft.item.ItemStack upgradeStack)
        Gets the harvest level for a tool with this upgrade installed. This is called only if modifiesToolStrength() returns true.
        Parameters:
        state - The block state being used to mine.
        toolStack - The ItemStack for the tool being used to mine.
        upgradeStack - The ItemStack for the upgrade.
        Returns:
        The strength against the block.

      • modifiesToolStrength

        default boolean modifiesToolStrength()
        Returns:
        If true, getToolStrength(IBlockState, ItemStack, ItemStack) will be used for the tool's Item.canHarvestBlock(IBlockState, ItemStack) implementation instead of the standard value.
